content: Whole Life Insurance Term Life Insurance Insurance Asked by Justin TanAsked on 28 Jan 2019Should I get term life or whole life insurance for those diagnosed with polycystic ovary syndrome? Does it affect the policies I can get?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 28 Jan 2019Depending on the insurer and current status of the condition, likely to be offered non standard terms. You may wish to do a preliminary underwriting application with the insurer of your choice to see what terms will be offered. This way, you won't have a 'black mark' when asked if you have been offered non standard terms on other applications 0 comments1

Brandan Chen, Financial Planner at Manulife SingaporeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 03 Feb 2019what Jonathan shared is right!Let me know should you like to apply for preliminary underwriting.You may reach out to me via my webpage at www.brandanchen.manulife.sg0 comments0
